title: 4.4 Writing letters - tto123
description: Deze les valt onder de arrangeerbare leerlijn van de Stercollecties voor Engels voor tweetalig onderwijs, leerjaar 1, 2 en 3. Dit is thema 4 'Contacts'. Het onderwerp van deze les is: Writing letters. In deze les wordt aandacht besteedt aan het schrijven van brieven. Daarnaast wordt brieven schrijven voor een goed doel beschreven en het onderwerp pen pals (penvrienden) komt aan bod. In de grammaticaopdracht wordt een grammaticatoets gegeven.

items.content:
The subject of this period is writing letters.

  • Form groups of three or four pupils.

Discuss the following questions in your group:

  • How often do you write letters?
  • How much does a stamp cost in the Netherlands? And for letters to Europe? And for letters outside Europe?
  • Where do you go if you want to post a letter?
  • Do you ever receive post?
  • Can you guess why snail mail is used for post delivered by the postman?
Step Activity Aim Time
Introduction Find out what you already know. 10
Step 1 listening
The post office		 You can understand a conversation about the post office and answer questions. 15
Step 2 Reading
Pen pals		 You can understand a text about pen pals and answer questions. 15
Step 3 Vocabulary You can understand and use the vocabulary about writing letters. 15
Step 4 Grammar
Grammar test		 You can take a grammar test. 15
Step 5 speaking
Discussion about pen pals		 You can have a discussion about pen pals. 10
Step 6 Writing
An essay about pen pals		 You can write an essay about pen pals. 15
Step 7 Evaluation Reflect on what you have learned. 05
Step 8 Extra
Writing love letters to my friend		 Watch the video.

The post office
You are going to listen to a conversation between Todd and Laura about the post office.

  • Read the questions.
  • Listen to the conversation.
  • Do assignment 1.
  • Listen again and do assignment 2.
  1. When she was young, who did she write letters to?
  2. Why has she stopped sending letters?
  3. From Hong Kong, how much is a postcard to Europe?
  4. Do people send mail from home in Hong Kong?
  5. What time do large post offices close?

prompt.body: When she was young, who did she write letters to?
From Hong Kong, how much is a postcard to Europe?
Do people send mail from home in Hong Kong?

content.body: No, you have to go to the P.O.

prompt.body: What time do large post offices close?

items.content:
You are going to listen to Laura again.


Now do the following exercise.

content.body:
Listen to the conversation and fill in the missing words

Todd: OK, Laura, I'm going to ask you about the post office in Hong Kong. OK, or just sending letters. How often do you ?

Laura: Well, when I was young, I wrote quite often to my pen pals, but right now, instead of sending a letter I usually send my friends.

Todd: Yeah! Me, too. How much does it cost to send a postcard in Hong Kong overseas?

Laura: Well, to Asian countries, it costs about , two Hong Kong dollars. To European countries it costs about .

Todd: OK, and when you send mail in Hong Kong, do you send it from your house, or do you..

Laura: Well, we have to go in order to send letters or parcels.

Todd: Really, OK! Cause it's so crowded in Hong Kong that...

Laura: Well, Yes, Yes!

Todd: OK, and in Japan do you receive a lot of mail?

Laura: Right now, no. Well, because it's so convenient to use the emails or instant communication or .

Todd: Yeah, OK last question. What time do post offices ?

Laura: Well, it depends on the size of the post office. For large ones, so, they work longer. Like from nine in the morning until six, so for a smaller one, from .

items.content:
Pen pals
Do you know what a pen pal is? Do you have one or have you ever had one?
Despite the ease of digital communications, many people find there's no replacing the personal touch that comes with a handwritten letter.

Read about Emma. She has pen pals and tells about her experience.

  • Read the text.
  • Do the assignment.

Two pals are better than one
Most people would be content with having one pen pal - but not Emma.
She's got two friends that she loves writing to.
In her report she tells us why it's pair-fect!
"I have two pen pals. One is called Alana.
Alana was my friend until she moved away.
The other is Ophelie, the pen pal that my school gave me.
She lives in France. I usually write letters to Alana as she doesn't live as far away.
But most of the time I e-mail Ophelie, as it takes so long if I don't!
I write to my pen pals about once a month.

Learning
I really look forward to getting letters or e-mails from my pen pals because I learn a lot about France or what my friends enjoy doing.
I learn about their lives and it gives me something to look forward to.
Having two pen pals also really improves my writing skills.
I write about hobbies, family, school and what I've been doing over the last few weeks.

Visits
I think one of the best parts of having pen pals is when they come over to stay.
I have never had a visit from Ophelie, but I am really looking forward to her visit with her school in June.
The worst thing about having pen pals is the wait for a reply, and when letters get stuck in the post!
My auntie is 40 and she still writes to her French pen pal that she got at school.

Juggling
I never get bored with my pen pals.
It's not hard juggling two because they rarely write at the same time and I enjoy writing.
I would strongly recommend getting a pen pal to those who don't have one. I've got two!"

Emma, 9, Dumfries and Galloway

Bron: CBBC Newsround

content.body:
Are the following statements true or false?

1. Most people want to have more than one pen pal. True False
2. Alana used to be Emma's best friend. True False
3. Ophelie lives in France. True False
4. Emma usually writes emails to Alana. True False
5. You can learn a lot from writing letters and emails. True False
6. One of the advantages of pen pals is you can visit each other. True False
7. Emma visits Ophelie every year. True False
8. This year Emma visits Ophelie in June. True False
9. A disadvantage is you sometimes have to wait a long time to receive a letter. True False
10. It takes a lot of time having two pen pals. True False

items.content:
To be able to do all the assignments correctly, you need to know some words and sentences.
For each theme there are word lists ready in Wozzol, with which you can practice:

Vocabularylist Writing letters

* email /e-mail: beide spellingen zijn correct in het Engels.

  • Study the vocabulary. (10 minutes)
  • Do the exercise.

Tip!
There are many ways to study vocabulary. You can read the words aloud or copy them. The most important rule is never to spend more than 10 minutes studying words. Every minute you spend longer is a waste of time.

content.body:
Fill in the correct word.
Choose from:
​come over to stay - emails - enjoy - look forward - open and close - parcels - pen pal - post office - receive - recommends - reply - sends - writing - writing skills

  1. Do you like letters?
  2. My teacher says everybody needs to have a .
  3. So, she us to have one.
  4. My dad always a lot of letters.
  5. But my mum prefers writing to her friends.
  6. My uncle works at the .
  7. The postman doesn't like delivering when they are too heavy.
  8. I always to hearing from my pen pal.
  9. Sometimes I have to wait a long time to get a .
  10. In July my pen pal will .

items.content:
Grammartest
You are about to finish the grammar part of this theme.
Before you finish, you will take a grammar test.

Study the folowing:

Adjective

Comparative and superlative

Asking questions - simple present

Negations - simple present

Question tags


If you pass the test, you will be ready for the next step!

Good luck!

prompt.body:
what is the adjective in the following sentence?

Do you usually feel nervous before an exam?

what is the adjective in the following sentence?

This person is very emotional.

content.body: This clown is funnier than that clown.
She is the best pupil of our class.
This is the most expensive watch I have ever seen.
Biology is more easy than chemistry.
He is bigger than his brother.
Britney Spears is younger than Madonna.
Jenny is the inteligentest pupil of our class.
This is the most terrible accident I have ever seen.
You aren't from Germany, aren't you?
Tim should work harder, shouldn't he?
These trousers don't fit, do they?
Nine years ago they became friends, didn't they?
The train arrived late, didn't it?
He reads a lot of magazines, doesn't he?
He went to school this morning, doesn't he?
She won't be able to see him tonight, will she?
We were often bored, weren't we?
She cries a lot, isn't she?

prompt.body:
Choose the correct question tags.

After working so hard he didn't deserve to fail the exam, ...

items.content:
Discussion about pen pals
You have read an article about pen pals. Now you are going to discuss about it. You might want to read the article again to prepare yourself for the discussion.

Two pals are better than one
Most people would be content with having one pen pal - but not Emma.
She's got two friends that she loves writing to.
In her report she tells us why it's pair-fect!
"I have two pen pals. One is called Alana.
Alana was my friend until she moved away.
The other is Ophelie, the pen pal that my school gave me.
She lives in France. I usually write letters to Alana as she doesn't live as far away.
But most of the time I e-mail Ophelie, as it takes so long if I don't!
I write to my pen pals about once a month.

Learning
I really look forward to getting letters or e-mails from my pen pals because I learn a lot about France or what my friends enjoy doing.
I learn about their lives and it gives me something to look forward to.
Having two pen pals also really improves my writing skills.
I write about hobbies, family, school and what I've been doing over the last few weeks.

Visits
I think one of the best parts of having pen pals is when they come over to stay.
I have never had a visit from Ophelie, but I am really looking forward to her visit with her school in June.
The worst thing about having pen pals is the wait for a reply, and when letters get stuck in the post!
My auntie is 40 and she still writes to her French pen pal that she got at school.

Juggling
I never get bored with my pen pals.
It's not hard juggling two because they rarely write at the same time and I enjoy writing.
I would strongly recommend getting a pen pal to those who don't have one. I've got two!"

Emma, 9, Dumfries and Galloway

Bron: CBBC Newsround


Discuss the following questions in your group:

  • Is it a good idea to have a pen pal?
  • Why? Why not?
  • What do you think is better: writing letters or writing emails. Why?
  • What can your learn from writing letters or emails?
  • What are the advantages or disadvantages of writing letters or emails?

An essay about pen pals
You have read an article about pen pals and you also discussed the subject. Now you are going to write a small essay about pen pals.
An essay is a short piece of writing on a particular subject. An essay has an introduction, a body and a conclusion.

Use the following prompts in your essay:

Introduction:

Explain what a pen pal is.

Body:

Mention the advantages and disadvantages of writing to a pen pal.

Conclusion:

Give your opinion about pen pals.
Give your opinion about writing letters or emails.

Ask your teacher how many words you have to use.

What have you learned in this period?
Answer the following questions:

  • What was the easiest part of this lesson?
  • What did you already know?
  • What was the most difficult part?
  • What was new to you in this lesson?
  • Do you have any questions for your teacher?

Writing love letters to my friends

You are going to look at a video about writing a love letter.

  • Watch the video.
  • What do you think of the video?
  • Write down what you like and what you don't like.
